channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: This afternoon. https://t.co/xE8fqeKfQf
Do you think people who are carrying a camera on a strap are aching for someone to take a photo of them, with them holding their camera?

Posit: People start to think the travel industry in Canada is shaky. Consequence: Canadians start avoiding travel. Result: Pretty soon the travel industry in Canada *is* shaky. https://t.co/jrACIY1NHT
The Canadian travel industry operates not on reality, but the perception of reality.
Whenever Khalid’s “OTW (ft. 6LACK, Ty Dolla $ign)” comes on the playlist. https://t.co/k1Z0AXwJn5

The Yorkville Rock will be in my forthcoming book, Toronto: The Good Parts. https://t.co/3uz5AypgJ6
The closest I could get to a microconfluence in Yorkville was 80 Bloor St./1200 Bay St. https://t.co/8Y6W44kq27
We’ll miss the Cumberland Terrace food court when it’s gone. https://t.co/yIYMZ6UN7v

I don’t want to alarm you, but I’m in Yorkville right now, and I don’t hate it.
This superior being visited me this morning, but I didn’t have anything for it. https://t.co/ZF43ptYjcE
The closest I could get to a microconfluence in Yorkville was 80 Bloor St./1200 Bay St. https://t.co/6dAcLCtaLY
We’ll miss the Cumberland Terrace food court when it’s gone. https://t.co/STn06GpW5a

Tonight. https://t.co/bHsLIDs2ub
I cried at least 4 times as Toronto’s premier Radiohead cover band played the legendary OK Computer album in its entirety.
@pinakographos Aww, did I miss my chance forever in being able to buy those cards?
@seanorr Oh, I would have liked to listen to this.
I love this feature. This helps with my decision fatigue around which game to play next. https://t.co/9egEPK8qgY
The @Parkbus @RougePark free shuttle is back! https://t.co/xNO4fAyU7B
TIL that Twitter now includes Bookmarks in their API, so I’d better get down to work. https://t.co/4hfMPh6fiH
Could this also happen to Collective Arts? https://t.co/2tfWydVxRa
@rtanglao @uncleweed It’s looking a lot like I won’t be going to Vancouver on that trip. :(
@uncleweed Thanks Dave. Current plans have me in British Columbia that week, and that has always been pleasant.
@ctototoo Punch-Drunk Love. https://t.co/SVCYrVx8fF
I’ve decided not to go to Ottawa to watch 3 basketball games in August.

Why does Gil Peñalosa’s Wikipedia page redirect to his brother’s? https://t.co/T0MhXoXbDY
The more I thought about it, the less sense it maid. I undid the redirect. Hopefully search engines catch on that it’s not redirecting anymore and index the page properly again.
The more I thought about it, the less sense it made. I undid the redirect. Hopefully search engines catch on that it’s not redirecting anymore and index the page properly again.
Gil Peñalosa’s Wikipedia page was redirecting to his brother’s page again today. The person who keeps re-instating the redirect calls Gil’s page spam. Huh?
I re-undid the redirect. That makes me part of a Wikipedia edit war, doesn’t it?
I’ve gotten 76 claps on this Medium post I wrote last year. https://t.co/gBG9nxlBPv
@domesticat Thanks for pointing that out! I added it to this page: https://t.co/JOc3dnay3F
@davewiner @waded FWIW, when I first heard about Bingeworthy, my mind immediately went to spongeworthy, and I thought for sure that was at least one of the reasons why you called it that.
Vancouver’s “news story of the 20th century” continues to leak into the 21st century. https://t.co/5naEFRnZun

Now, a decade and a half later, you can go up on a steep hill in Silicon Valley and look out, and with the right kind of eyes you can almost see the high-water mark of the blogosphere—that place where the wave finally broke and rolled back. https://t.co/Rxbpj055VA

Yet another article about a company opening an office in Toronto that doesn’t mention a disease that we can get even if vaccinated, which shreds our lungs and causes permanent brain damage, that we’ll get over and over until it ultimately kills us. https://t.co/y1lVP0GZ93
@wjfarr @DumasRaphael Amazing. This rings true. I think I know what my weakness is. Hopefully I’m right, and hopefully, if it already happened, it was only for a few dollars. https://t.co/dDICBlOudD
